assign.name: Assignment #3: Explore Self-Regulation in Greater Detail
assign.intro:
Explore the research behind self-regulated learning. Read the resources under the "General" heading, then read the resources under the "Writing" or "Math" headings depending on your focus. After you read the resources, write a two-to three-paragraph reflection of what you learned (click Edit my submission).

General

  1. The Role of Self-Regulated Learning in Contextual Teaching: Principles and Practices for Teacher Preparation -- Paris & Winograd (2003) This article defines and describes self-regulated learning; shows how teachers can use self-regulation strategies for their own professional growth.

Writing

  1. Strategies for Composition and Self-Regulation in the Writing Process -- Harris, Schmidt, & Graham (1997) Few people-either children or adults-would describe writing as a very easy process that they complete without much effort. Writing is a highly complex and demanding process.

  2. Research for the Future - Becoming a Self-Regulated Writer: A Social Cognitive Perspective  --Zimmerman & Risemberg (1997) Becoming an adept writer involves more than knowledge of vocabulary and grammar, it depends on high levels of personal regulation because writing activities are usually self-planned, self-initiated, and self-sustained.

Math

  1. Improving Mathematical Problem Solving in Grades 4 Through 8: A Practice Guide, Recommendation #2, Assist students in monitoring and reflecting on the problem solving process, pp.17-21. (optional: read the full version.)

  2. Becoming Mathematically Literate and Numerate, Chapter 4 in Adult Basic Education Level 3 (Adult 10) Mathematics Curriculum Guide, pp.41-58. (Optional: Read the full version)
